It's a cute sweater, but it's huge, long, and the material is very thin. I'm 5'2 and it covered my entire butt. I was also swimming in a small (depending on item and brand I fluctuate between and small and medium). I like this sweater a lot! I got XL for an oversized look and it’s nice and big, without looking frumpy. I’m 6 feet and the sleeves are long enough! It’s light weight with medium warmth.

The small is definitely a little big on me (5'2" and 140 pounds).  Also, the elbow patches feel like plastic so I'm not sure how durable they'll be.  I do think it is a good sweater for the price.

I was expecting this sweater to be a chunky knit sweater. It’s more of a regular shirt. The elbow patches are really cute. It’s quality made, but it’s false advertising to call it thick. Also, the band at the bottom is tight so it balloons out rather than just falling down the waist and makes it fit awkwardly. I really wanted to like this sweater and keep putting it back on thinking I’ll change my mind. But, I never do. Returning.

The gray is much lighter in person than the image shown, but it is still a nice sweater. It fits well and can be styled so it doesn’t look like a shapeless sack on your body, which sounds simple but is actually a problem for many oversized sweater options.

This cute, simple, soft sweater is worth the buy. There is nothing fancy about it and fits my style well. All this said, the tag reads "dry clean recommended". I would never dry clean a sweater that was this price. I'm hoping it will hold up on delicate/hand wash cycle.

Bought this for my daughter, who is a size Small. The sweater is big--big enough that my kiddo who likes oversized things questioned whether or not it was too big.  It is VERY cute, otherwise. Colors are very bright and the sweater is soft.

I wouldn't say it runs small, it's just not a comfy shape, much closer to the body. I got a Large and for reference I got it as a gift for someone who is 5'6, 150lbs with a 36 bust. Got it as a gift and it was a hit and sooooooo cute!
